curam.util.dataaccess

Class ReadmultiOperation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.dataaccess.ReadmultiOperation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the row in the result set
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtractReadMultiOperation, StandardReadmultiOperation

    public abstract class ReadmultiOperation<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Curam "readmulti" operation is one which retrieves multiple rows from the application database. Each entity's readmulti operations comes in two forms - the simplest of these returns all of the target database rows as a vector in memory. The second form takes an instance of ReadmultiOperation which is called for each of the rows in the target result set. This allows developers to produce there own custom processing for result sets, without ever having to assemble the entire result set in memory at one time.

    When subclassing ReadmultiOperation, you must provide an implementation of the "operation" method, which is called for each row in the result set. All other methods are optional.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReadmultiOperation

        public ReadmultiOperation()

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public boolean filter(T dtls)
               throws AppException,
                      InformationalException
        Called with each row of the result set. If filter() returns true, then the row is passed to the operation() method, otherwise it is discarded. filter() can be used to implement conditional logic in a ReadmultiOperation separately from the business logic in the operation() method which operates on the unfiltered rows. The default filter operation returns "true", indicating that the result row SHOULD be passed to operation().
        Parameters:
        dtls - The column values of the result row
        Returns:
        True if the row should be passed to the operation() method.
        Throws:
        AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • first

        public void first(T dtls)
           throws AppException,
                  InformationalException
        Called with the FIRST row of a result set. Note that first is called as long as there is at least one row in the result set, regardless of whether or not filter() returns true for this row. The default first() operation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        dtls - The column values of the first result row
        Throws:
        AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • operation

        public abstract boolean operation(T dtls)
                           throws AppException,
                                  InformationalException
        Called with each row of the result set for which filter() returns true. If operation() returns false, the readmulti process stops at that point, and no more rows are passed to operation(). The default operation() is abstract, and thus MUST be implemented by subclasses.
        Parameters:
        dtls - The column values of the result row
        Returns:
        A flag indicating that the readmulti should continue. Implementations should normally return true.
        Throws:
        AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • post

        public void post()
          throws AppException,
                 InformationalException
        Called after the last row has been passed to the operation() method. The default implementation does nothing
        Throws:
        AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • pre

        public void pre()
         throws AppException,
                InformationalException
        Called before the first row has been passed to the operation() method. The default implementation does nothing
        Throws:
        AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • getMaximum

        public int getMaximum()
        Provides the maximum number of rows that should be returned by a readmulti operation. 0 is a special case meaning all rows should be returned. If more rows are present than the maximum a ReadmultiMaxException is thrown by the data access code.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of rows that should be returned by a readmulti operation. The default is zero.

      • requireInformational

        public boolean requireInformational()
        Returns whether the informationalRequired parameter has been set in the constructor of this Operation.
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating if the informationalRequired parameter has been set.

      • onMaximumReached

        public void onMaximumReached()
                      throws ReadmultiMaxException,
                             InformationalException
        Behavior required when the maximum numbers of records have been reached.
        Throws:
        ReadmultiMaxException - ReadmultiMaxException - the default behavior here is to throw a ReadmultiMaxException. This can be overridden in sub-classes of ReadmultiOperation.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
